description: Conversion of existing single family house to two self-contained residential units and part ground floor rear extension.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: Fire strategy statement, Flood Risk Assessment,  SH1, SH2, SH6, SH7, SH8, SH9 
Received: 02/04/2024

Full SAP Calculation, Client & Building Control Notes, U-Value Calculator Reports. Received: 25/07/2024

SH3(rev.A), SH4(rev.A), SH5(rev.A). Received: 28/08/2024

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - The new dwelling hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the rear extension shown on the approved plans has been erected in its entirety. 
Reason ï¿½ In the interest of the living conditions of future occupiers of the site and to ensure that the new dwelling meet minimum floor area requirements. 
Condition : 4 - The first floor bathrooms formed in the rear elevation as shown on drawing number SH4(rev.A), of the hereby approved development shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Reason: To safeguard the visual amenities of the locality and privacy of future occupiers in accordance with policy CC2 of the adopted Local Plan.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved development or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Reason: In order not to prejudice amenities of any adjoining properties and in order that the Local Planning Authority is able to exercise control over future development of the site
Condition : 6 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and
resources in accordance with London Plan policy SI5 and adopted
Local Plan policy EQ2.
Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of secure and sheltered storage for 2 cycles, including manufacturer's specification, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding any details included in the submitted plans, prior to above ground works, details of landscape works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include:
(a) means of enclosure/boundary treatments
(b) pedestrian access and circulation areas;
(c) hard surfacing materials

Reason: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and the area and to promote biodiversity.
Condition : 9 - Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved development the waste and recycling store shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and in accordance
with policies CC1, CC2 and EQ7 of the adopted Local Plan 
Condition : 10 - The rear garden shall be sub-divided as shown on the plan drawing numbered SH3(rev.A) and thereafter maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted. 

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions for the occupiers of proposed dwellings
